definition: Virgil or Vergilius (70-19 BC), Roman poet and author of the Aeneid 埃涅阿斯紀|埃涅阿斯纪[Ai1 nie4 a1 si1 Ji4]
abbr. for Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]/surname Wei
to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])
surname Ji/abbr. for Jilin Province 吉林省[Ji2 lin2 Sheng3]

sentences.english: You want to know why the spell didn't break, hmm, Vergil?
sentences.chinese: 你想知道爲什麼咒語沒有解開嗎，嗯，維吉爾？

sentences.english: Now we all know what Virgil's poetic career would go on to look like.
sentences.chinese: 現在我們都知道維吉爾的詩歌職業是如何發展的了。

sentences.english: He has taken it from one of the pastoral poems of Virgil.
sentences.chinese: 他是從維吉爾的一首田園詩中借鑑的。

sentences.english: Virgil tells of he suicide when she was abandoned by Aeneas.
sentences.chinese: 維吉爾說她被阿流斯拋棄後自殺而死。

sentences.english: But aren't you forgetting something, Vergil?
sentences.chinese: 但你們真的沒有忘記什麼嗎，維吉爾？

sentences.english: You want to know why the speel didn't break, hmm, Vergil?
sentences.chinese: 你想知道爲什麼咒語沒有破解嗎，嗯，維吉爾？

sentences.english: But you've taken quite a trouncing today, haven't you, Vergil?
sentences.chinese: 但你今天已經元氣大傷了，對不對，維吉爾？

sentences.english: The poem is based most closely on Virgil's Tenth Eclogue.
sentences.chinese: 這首詩取材於維吉爾的《牧歌》第十首。
